intro: Bucholzia polygonoides var. diffusa, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by green, round fruits resembling miniature watermelons. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, making it an important plant in traditional medicine and local folklore.
